meanings.sent1: After the party, he was so pished he couldn't walk straight.
meanings.sent2: She felt pished after having too many drinks at the bar.
meanings.sent3: The pished man tried to dance but ended up tripping over his own feet.
meanings.sent4: The pished group stumbled out of the pub, laughing loudly.
meanings.sent5: The pished sailor sang sea shanties at the top of his lungs.

meanings.sent1: She was pished when her computer crashed right before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: He gets pished whenever someone interrupts him while he's working.
meanings.sent3: The pished customer complained about the slow service at the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The pished cat hissed at anyone who came near its food bowl.
meanings.sent5: The pished child stomped their feet in frustration.

meanings.sent1: The pished vase lay shattered on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The old toy was pished beyond repair.
meanings.sent3: The pished phone screen cracked after it fell from the table.
meanings.sent4: The pished car sputtered and stopped in the middle of the road.
meanings.sent5: The pished window was covered in cracks from the storm.
